description: Esophageal thickening refers to an abnormal increase in the wall thickness of the esophagus, often indicating inflammation or an underlying medical condition.

attributes.name: Location
attributes.description: This refers to the anatomical region where esophageal thickening is situated

attributes.name: Severity
attributes.description: Severity refers to the degree of abnormal thickening observed in the esophageal wall.

values.name: Mild
values.description: There is slight or minimal esophageal wall thickening.

values.name: Moderate
values.description: Esophageal wall thickening is more pronounced but not extensive.

values.name: Severe
values.description: There is significant and substantial esophageal wall thickening.

attributes.name: Cause
attributes.description: Indicates the possible cause of the esophageal thickening.

values.name: Esophagitis
values.description: Esophagitis refers to inflammation or irritation of the esophagus.

values.name: Gastroesophageal Reflux
values.description: Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) is a condition where stomach acid and contents flow back into the esophagus.

values.name: Inflammatory
values.description: Inflammatory conditions, can cause esophageal thickening due to chronic inflammation and tissue damage.

values.name: Nonspecific
values.description: Nonspecific esophageal thickening refers to cases where the exact cause of thickening cannot be definitively identified.

attributes.name: Size
attributes.description: The size of the esophageal thickening

values.name: absent
values.description: No esophageal wall thickening is present.

values.name: indeterminate
values.description: Cannot determine whether esophageal wall thickening is present.

values.name: unknown
values.description: It indicates uncertainty regarding whether esophageal wall thickening is present.
